question:
Your neighbours have recently written to you to complain about the noise from your house/ flat.

Write a letter to your neighbours. In your letter

explain the reasons for the noise
apologise
describe what action you will take
text: Thanks for your letter. I am sorry to learn that the noise coming out from my apartment has been giving you serious concern.

You can recall, I just moved into the apartment and recently noticed there have been some defects on the decking of the building and since we are on the first floor directly above you, it has made the noise worse.
I have drawn the attention of the landlord to this disturbance and he brought his builders to have a look and proffer solutions. He has promised it will be done in the next two weeks.

In the interim, pending when this will be resolved, I have engaged my kids in after school program that will take them to closing in the evening. When they are back home it will be for them to go to bed. This will reduce the movement activities in my apartment.
Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconveniences this has caused you.

The to-infinitive that follows the verb take requires the base form. Change closing to the base form.
